snippet: If Verdant Power is to generate electricity at the bottom of the East River, it will first have to build a turbine that can withstand the river’s strong and shifting currents.
abstract: Verdant Power pulls electrical turbine up from the bottom of the East River, after 10-day test of its long-running plan to turn New York City tides into a source of electricity; the company hopes in about five years to have 30 turbines arrayed in the river, each capable of producing 35 kilowatts of electricity, enough to power a few hundred homes.
lead_paragraph: If Verdant Power is to generate electricity at the bottom of the East River, it will first have to build a turbine that can withstand the river’s strong and shifting currents.

headline.seo: In Quest for East River’s Power, a Search for Stouter Arms
headline.main: In Quest for River’s Power, an Underwater Test Spin
headline.print_headline: In Quest for River’s Power, An Underwater Test Spin
